rukus.text: O you messengers! Eat of the good things and do right; verily, I am aware of what you do
And, verily, this your religion (or brotherhood) is one religion (or brotherhood), and I am your Lord; so keep your duty unto Me
But they (mankind) have broken their religion (or affair) between them into sects, each sect rejoicing in its own tenets
So leave them in their confused error (or ignorance) for a time
Think they that in the wealth and children, wherewith We provide them
We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not
Verily, those who walk in awe of their Lord
And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord
And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord
And those who give what they give with heart afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord
These race to good things, and they shall be the first in the race
But We will not oblige a soul beyond its capacity; for with us is a Record that utters the truth, and they shall not be wronged
Nay, their heart are in ignorance of this, and they do deeds beside this which they continue to do
Until, when We catch the affluent ones amongst them with the punishment, then lo! They cry in supplication
Supplicate not this day! Assuredly, you will not be helped by (or against) Us
My revelations were recited to you, but you turned back upon your heels
In arrogant scorn thereof, raving vain nonsensical tales by night
Have they not pondered over the words, or has something new come unto them which came not to their forefathers
Or know they not their messenger that they thus deny him
Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, but he came to them with the Truth, and most of them are haters of Truth

But if the truth were to conform to their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth and whoever is therein would be corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Reminder (The Quran), but from their Reminder they now turn away
Or do you ask them for a tribute? But the bounty of your Lord is better, for He is the best of those who provide
And, verily, you do call them to the Straight Way
But, verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, they are indeed astray from that Way
But if We had mercy on them, and relieved their distress, they still would persist in their rebellion, blindly wandering on
And We caught them with the punishment, but they humble not themselves before their Lord, nor do they pray
Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme torment, then lo! They are plunged into despair
